managers

Class GameStateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • managers.GameStateManager

  • public class GameStateManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameStateManager is, once implemented, responsible for managing the current game state the program is on. It accomplishes this by using Java's Stack class, to pop and push states.
    Version:
    1.0 13/05/2016

    Instance Variables

    game Instance of MainGame used to manage the screen of the game

    gameStates Instance of the Stack class used to manage and store the different game states

    PLAY Used to set the first value of the Stack.

    Author:
    Brian Tran

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private MainGame game 
      private java.util.Stack<GameState> gameStates 
      static int PLAY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameStateManager(MainGame game)
      The GameStateManager constructor takes a MainGame from Play and other classes and sets the current MainGame to the value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameStateManager

        public GameStateManager(MainGame game)
        The GameStateManager constructor takes a MainGame from Play and other classes and sets the current MainGame to the value. The constructor also instantiates the gameStates variable, and then pushes the first value of Stack.
        Parameters:
        game - Handles on screen elements
